andrzej.appdemo.shipwar

Class ShipwarGame

  • java.lang.Object
    • andrzej.appdemo.shipwar.ShipwarGame

  • public class ShipwarGame
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is responsible for controlling the game It provides methods to check the placement of ships, determine the active player, conduct fire, end the game.
    Author:
    Pawe≈Ç Guzik

    • Method Detail

      • countUsedSquares

        public static int countUsedSquares(andrzej.appdemo.user.User user)
        Calculates the number of ships placed on the board.
        Parameters:
        user - the user for which we check ships number on his board.
        Returns:
        number of ships placed on the board.

      • checkShipsPossitionsBeforeGame

        public static boolean checkShipsPossitionsBeforeGame(andrzej.appdemo.user.User user)
        Checks whether the placement of ships on the board is consistent with the rules. List of rules: - ships can only be placed horizontally - there can be only 1 four-masted, 2 three-masted, 3 two-masted, 3 one-masted ships
        Parameters:
        user - the user for which we check ships positions on his board.
        Returns:
        true if the placement of ships is right.

      • checkIfShipsPossitionIsAvalible

        public static boolean checkIfShipsPossitionIsAvalible(andrzej.appdemo.user.User user)
        Returns true if the ship can be set on the position shipPos in the String table in the User object.
        Parameters:
        user - the user for which we check ship position
        Returns:
        true if the ship can be set on the position * shipPos or false otherwise.

      • checkRightSide

        private static boolean checkRightSide(java.lang.String[] warTable,
                                      int currentPos)
        Checks if the ship is on the right side for current position.
        Parameters:
        warTable - the table representing the location of ships.
        currentPos - position for which we check presence of other ships.
        Returns:
        true if there is a ship on the right.

      • setRoundAndShot

        public static void setRoundAndShot(andrzej.appdemo.user.User user,
                                   andrzej.appdemo.user.User enemy,
                                   java.lang.String shipPos)
        If the user is an active player then enemy is fired and if after this the enemy has ships, activePlayer's flag goes to the enemy.
        Parameters:
        user - the user who shoots the enemy's ship in position ship pos
        enemy - the user to whom the user shoots.
        shipPos - place where user shoots.

      • countShipsLeft

        public static int countShipsLeft(andrzej.appdemo.user.User user)
        Counts how many ships left after firing.
        Parameters:
        user - the user for whom we check the number of ships we check
        Returns:
        the number of ships remaining on the board.

      • endGameMain

        public static void endGameMain(andrzej.appdemo.user.User user,
                               andrzej.appdemo.user.UserService userService)
        when one of the players loses all ships, this function clears the data about the finished game, in the user object and in the database.
        Parameters:
        user - the user whose game data will be deleted.
        userService - is the object responsible for communication with the database.
